newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco's SNI ceded 30 pct stake in car firm.
newsitem.headline: Morocco's SNI ceded 30 pct stake in car firm.

text.p: Morocco's second largest private conglomerate Societe Nationale d'Investissement, ceded its 30 percent stake in a car accessory firm worth 2.9 million dirhams ($0.34 million), Upline Securities stockbroker said on Tuesday.

"SNI ceded its stake in Renault Industrie Maroc due to risks related to the dependance on one sole client and one sole supplier," Mohamed Mekouar, analyst at the Casablanca-based Upline Securities said.
The client and supplier is the leading French-Moroccan company Renault Maroc.
SNI's move confirms the holding is focusing its interest on the traditional activities which are finance, agro-industry and cement, Mekouar added.
Its most profitable listed companies are cement firm Ciments Artificiels de Meknes, edible oil firm Leusieur, and sugar refinery Cosumar,
One of the 46 listed stocks on the Casablanca bourse, SNI has a market capitalisation of 5.6 billion dirhams and was last traded at 570 dirhams.
SNI holding was established in Casablanca in 1966 and has a capital of 990 million dirhams.
It made a net profit of 30 million dirhams in the first half of the year but gave no comparison for the same period in 1995.
